name: incongruence
content:

formal the state of not being suitable or not fitting well with something else: a review of the incongruence between their beliefs and practices regarding marriage Incongruence occurs when nonverbal behaviour contradicts a person’s words.
mathematics
  specialized the fact that a shape does not have the same shape and size as another: Notice the incongruence of the triangles. The incongruence of geometric shapes can be described mathematically. See
incongruent
More examplesFewer examplesThere was an incongruence between law and commercial activity.In winter you might have the incongruence of opening windows to counteract an overactive heating system.When I weigh myself, there’s an incongruence between the number on the scale and other measures of my health.
